metadata.title: CVE-2022-23491 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Certifi is a curated collection of Root Certificates for validating thetrustworthiness of SSL certificates while verifying the identity of TLShosts. Certifi 2022.12.07 removes root certificates from "TrustCor" fromthe root store. These are in the process of being removed from Mozilla'strust store. TrustCor's root certificates are being removed pursuant to aninvestigation prompted by media reporting that TrustCor's ownership alsooperated a business that produced spyware. Conclusions of Mozilla'sinvestigation can be found in the linked google group discussion.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-23491` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ca-certificates - 20211016ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ca-certificates package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '20211016ubuntu0.18.04.1').
